text: I have the same question. Is there any answer?

Might be a dumb question but I’ll risk it: we need a way to send events from our platform to HubSpot. The catch: the events must be sent from the client (a plugin on top of an ms-office product), as opposed to from the back-end. This means we can’t use any API call that authenticates via the api key, for obvious security reasons. Anyone who’s done it and can point me in the right direction, including confirming there’s no way to do it except from the backend? Tnx!

Hey guys not sure if this is the right channel to ask, if not please redirect me to the right one. We are looking to make a custom action on a contact to open a pop up modal and send a whatsapp message. How can this be done on the API? Here is an example on how another app add a "button" below the contact that trigger the modal. (edited)

Hello im trying to figure out how to import the HubSpot node api wrapper via a script tag in my index.html. Can anyone help me with the proper way to do this. ive tried serveral `src`  so far and keep getting `Uncaught ReferenceError: require is not defined`

Is there a way to filter a "Get All Contacts" serverless to only include contacts that meet certain criteria (like a property value)?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contacts>
Hey <@UFBA31SP5>, the API you would want to use to accomplish this would be the CMS Source Code API here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/source-code>
Many thanks! Crazy I missed this obe
have you checked out the search endpoint?

you can use the search contact endpoint
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/search_contacts>
I would push for the v3 endpoint :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
